Uses of Package
es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4

Packages that use es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4
es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4   
es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command   
es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.test   
es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.test.mock   
 

Classes in es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4 used by es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4
Game
          Represents the state of all the elements of the game (locations, items, player inventory, etc.), and relevant constants for the game (the available movement directions, the keywords for a game textual definition, etc.).
Game.Direction
          Represents all the possible directions for the connections between locations: NORTH, NORTHEAST, EAST, SOUTHEAST, SOUTH, SOUTHWEST, WEST, NORTHWEST, UP, DOWN, IN and OUT.
Item
          Represents an item that can be placed in the player inventory or in the locations of the game.
ItemRepository
          Represents a repository of items, as the player inventory or the contents of a location.
Location
          Represents a location of the game, that may have items and connections to other locations.
Obstacle
           
Parser
          Represents the parser of the game engine that analyzes the input stream and identifies valid commands.
 

Classes in es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4 used by es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command
Game
          Represents the state of all the elements of the game (locations, items, player inventory, etc.), and relevant constants for the game (the available movement directions, the keywords for a game textual definition, etc.).

          Represents an item that can be placed in the player inventory or in the locations of the game.
Parser
          Represents the parser of the game engine that analyzes the input stream and identifies valid commands.

Classes in es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4 used by es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.test.mock
Engine
          Represents the game engine that controls the execution of the game since the beginning to the end, dealing with the configuration, the input stream and the output stream.
Game
          Represents the state of all the elements of the game (locations, items, player inventory, etc.), and relevant constants for the game (the available movement directions, the keywords for a game textual definition, etc.).
Item
          Represents an item that can be placed in the player inventory or in the locations of the game.
Location
